page.title: 18MOTSPUR PARK BRANCH LINE (2)
page.content: {Troops of the}Royal Engineers{built {the embankment further along its {intended route as a training exercise. {The abandoned workings, still to be {seen near Chalky Lane, have long since {been covered in undergrowth. Nov.6,1947 saw the first fatal accident on the line. A crash in dense fog killed 4 passengers near Motspur Park. In 1954, the Queen went home from the Derby via Chessington South station. { The line today is very much a local {asset; most of the journeys are short {'hops' between Malden & Chessington. {Schoolchildren use it to cross the {Borough N to S, & commuters travel {into}LONDON{daily via Chessington {North & Tolworth stations in {particular. { }
